bill_title: to nominate and elect county officers in nonpolitical elections.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to nominate and elect county officers in nonpolitical elections. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any candidate for any county office as required by law to be elected shall be nominated and voted for at the primary and general elections as provided in this Act and not otherwise. Section 2. It is a Class 2 misdemeanor for any political party to endorse or nominate by any convention or any other method any candidate for county office. Section 3. The county auditor shall designate each individual county office position to be filled by election. A candidate for county office shall indicate the specific position for which the candidate is running. Section 4. Nominating petitions for county office filed pursuant to this Act shall state the position sought using the designations established pursuant to section 3 of this Act which shall be filed in the office of the county auditor within the time prescribed by § 12-6-4 and shall be signed by not less than fifty registered voters of the county or commissioner district. To the extent it is consistent with this chapter, § 12-6-8 shall govern such petitions. Section 5. No reference may be made to any party ballot or to the party affiliation of the candidate in any petition filed by or on behalf of any candidate for nomination to county office at any primary election or any attachment thereto. Section 6. If nominating petitions filed on behalf of candidates do not exceed twice the number of persons for the number of county office positions to be filled, the names of the candidates do not need to be placed upon the primary ballot but the candidates shall be the nominees for the county office positions. Section 7. The order of names of county office candidates shall be arranged by lot. Any candidate may be present or represented when the arrangement is being determined. Section 8. At all primary elections at which candidates for county office are to be nominated and a primary is required, there shall be prepared and furnished by the county auditor, separate ballots upon which the names of the candidates shall be placed for the county offices, which ballots shall be entitled "nonpolitical county office ballot" and shall contain no other designation. The names of all candidates shall be placed on the ballot without any party designation. Section 9. The form of the nonpolitical county office ballot shall be prescribed by the State Board of Elections. Section 10. The nominees shall be those persons constituting twice the number of persons to be elected receiving the highest number of votes in the primary election. Section 11. If after nominations have been made under the provisions of this chapter and the number of nominees for a county office shall be reduced through death, withdrawal, or disqualification of a nominee or nominees for such office, the registered voters of the county may, if there is sufficient time for filing a nominating petition pursuant to § 12-8-6, nominate one or more candidates for such county office by a petition otherwise complying with section 4 of this Act. Section 12. That § 12-5-1.4 be amended to read as follows: 12-5-1.4. If a political party qualifies for the primary ballot under § 12-5-1, candidates intending to participate in the primary election the first year of qualification shall file nominating petitions pursuant to § 12-6-4. However, if no voting history exists to determine the number of signatures required, state or federal candidates shall file petitions bearing signatures of at least two hundred fifty registered voters in the new party , and legislative and county candidates shall file petitions bearing signatures of at least five registered voters in the new party. Section 13. That § 12-6-7.1 be amended to read as follows: 12-6-7.1. Notwithstanding the provisions of § 12-6-7 , a nominating petition for a candidate for office in the state Legislature , county political public office and county party office shall be signed by not less than fifty voters or not less than one percent of the voters who cast their vote for the party's gubernatorial candidate, whichever is less. The petition shall clearly designate the senatorial or representative district for which said individual is a candidate. Section 14. That § 12-6-9 be amended to read as follows: 12-6-9. A candidate for nomination to an office, or election to a party office, having no opposing candidate within his the candidate's party, shall automatically become the nominee of his the candidate's party or elected party official for said office, and his the candidate's name shall may not be printed on the primary election ballot. If there are no opposing candidates for nomination or election of either state or county candidates in any county, no primary election shall may be held in that county, and the candidates shall be automatically nominated or elected.
